operations.summary: Resets the PingFederate configuration to default values
Resets the PingAccess OAuth Client configuration to default values
Get the PingAccess OAuth Client configuration
Update the PingFederate OAuth Client configuration
Resets the PingFederate Admin configuration to default values

cacheTokens.description: Enable to retain token details for subsequent requests.

clientId.description: The Client ID which PingAccess should use when requesting PingFederate to validate access tokens. The client must have Access Token Validation grant type allowed.

clientSecret.description: The Client Secret for the Client ID.

sendAudience.description: Enable to send the URI the user requested as the 'aud' OAuth parameter for PingAccess to use to select an Access Token Manager.

subjectAttributeName.description: The attribute you want to use from the OAuth access token as the subject for auditing purposes.

tokenTimeToLiveSeconds.description: Defines the number of seconds to cache the access token. -1 means no limit. This value should be less than the PingFederate Token Lifetime.

encryptedValue.description: The encrypted value of the field, as originally returned by the API.

value.description: The value of the field. This field takes precedence over the encryptedValue field, if both are specified.

auditLevel.description: Enable to record requests to PingFederate to the audit store.

backChannelBasePath.description: The base path, if needed, for the PingFederate Runtime accessed using a Back Channel hostname.

backChannelSecure.description: Enable if PingFederate is expecting HTTPS connections for calls via the Back Channel hostnames.

basePath.description: The base path, if needed, for PingFederate Runtime.

expectedHostname.description: The name of the host expected in the certificate.

host.description: The host name or IP address for PingFederate Runtime.

port.description: The port number for PingFederate Runtime.

secure.description: Enable if PingFederate is expecting HTTPS connections.

skipHostnameVerification.description: Enable if the Back Channel servers should not perform hostname verification of the certificate.

targets.description: One or more server hostname:port pairs used to access the PingFederate server from inside a private network.

trustedCertificateGroupId.description: The group of certificates to use when authenticating to PingFederate.

useProxy.description: True if a proxy should be used for HTTP or HTTPS requests.

useSlo.description: Enable if OIDC single log out should be used on the /pa/oidc/logout on the engines.

adminPassword.description: The password for the administrator username.

auditLevel.description: Enable to record requests to the PingFederate Administrative API to the audit store.

basePath.description: The base path, if needed, for Administration API.

host.description: The host name or IP address for PingFederate Administration API.

port.description: The port number for PingFederate Administration API.

secure.description: Enable if PingFederate is expecting HTTPS connections.

trustedCertificateGroupId.description: The group of certificates to use when authenticating to PingFederate Administrative API.

useProxy.description: True if a proxy should be used for HTTP or HTTPS requests.
